events.name: Starting with Kanban: A practical workshop on Value Stream Mapping and WIP
events.description: So you’ve heard about this Kanban thing and want to know where to start, or maybe you’ve been using it for a while and you want to know where to go. In this hands-on workshop, we'll start at the very beginning and teach you how to build a Value Stream Map and use that to define your initial Kanban and WIP limits. If these terms don’t make sense to you, then you need to come to this workshop. Want to learn more: • Learn how to create your VSM; the commonly overlooked practice of modelling the functional steps in your business processes - anything from IT to finance • Track the flow of work through your VSM on your Kanban wall • Learn how to use your VSM, team size and process efficiency to calculate your initial WIP. • Learn how to embed a culture of Kaizen If this sounds interesting, come along for a fun interactive workshop by Evan Leybourn Pizza will be provided by our sponsor Ecquaria .
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, 22nd Floor, One Marina Boulevard, NTUC Cebtre

events.name: Double Bill! Apache Hive + ScalaJs
events.description: Lloyd from PayPal will be giving a talk on ScalaJS. ScalaJS is a Scala to Javascript compiler which allows you to write your entire web application in scala. This talk will provide an introduction to ScalaJS and some of the cool stuff related to it. Raymond will be talking on Apache Spark. Apache Spark has been touted as the next big thing in the big data space. The fact that Hive and Mahout have ditched the MapReduce approach and are moving their code base to Spark, is a smoking gun. If you are wondering what it is and what you can do with it, join us to find out! There'll be Pizza and drinks so please RSVP to help us get an estimate on how much to order!
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: Creative Crew Talks - January Meeting 2015
events.description: Using Adobe Illustrator efficiently as a Designer By Mark Plunkett When it comes to designing layouts and creation of logo, you will most likely be using Adobe Illustrator as your number one software. It doesn’t really matter if you are a beginner or an advanced user of Adobe Illustrator, the hottest topic would be about why Adobe Illustrator takes so long to load and save a file. In this session, Mark Plunkett - Director and Designer of Dexel, a graphic design agency will share about some of his most used tips and features during projects at his workplace. ===================== Creative design tools for Mobile App Developers By Arul Kumaran Hear from Arul Kumaran, CTO and Multiplatform Developer at Luracast Singapore to share his experience on the design and development of mobile applications. Developers will also need to know design tools well in order to better market their apps. In this session, you will explore some of the techniques using image editing tool, Adobe Photoshop and screen design tool, Adobe Fireworks on developing mobile apps. He will also share some of the plugins that can make them even more powerful and helpful for the given tasks. ===================== Allow your designs to shine By Linus Lim One of the design principles is to create order and hierarchy in your designs resulting in beautiful and easy to read layouts. In this session you will learn the tips to apply alignments into your designs to give them a professional edge. Icons are used everywhere in user interfaces for websites and mobile apps. The design principle for designing icons is to keep them simple, modern and friendly. Linus will also share how he draws icons for your screen design.
